diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Pancreatic head mass concerning for malignancy; Liver hemangioma; Chronic GI bleed; Colonic polyps; Duodenal ulcer
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Patient presented with acute on chronic abdominal pain, elevated lipase, guaiac positive stool indicating gastrointestinal bleeding, and CT findings of pancreatic duct dilatation and multiple liver lesions. These findings supported the diagnosis of acute on chronic pancreatitis and raised concern for malignancy.
